episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and humorous facts, including a prison Sudoku puzzle complaint, automotive chickens in France, the preservation of books in libraries through freezing, and a nominative determinism example involving an ophthalmologist with a fitting name.

facts.fact: In 2015, 86 inmates at the Exeter prison wrote an angry letter to their local newspaper, complaining that the weekly Sudoku puzzle was too hard to complete.
In 1913, it was claimed that French farmers were raising automotive chickens, which were bred specifically to throw themselves under passing cars so the farmer could claim compensation.
When libraries flood, the books are saved by putting them in the freezer and then vacuuming them.
There is an ophthalmologist at the University of Leiden called Dr I.C. Notting.
